str2: Consequently, therefore, well then, so then. From toi and gar and oun; truly for then, i.e. Consequently.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: From peri and keimai; to lie all around, i.e. Inclose, encircle, hamper.
So great, so large, so long, so many. From tosos and houtos; so vast as this, i.e. Such.
A cloud; met: a dense crowd, a multitude, great company. Apparently a primary word; a cloud.
A witness (judicially) or figuratively (genitive case); by analogy, a 'martyr'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To lay off or aside, renounce, stow away, put. From apo and tithemi; to put away.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
(properly: bulk, mass, hence) a weight, burden, encumbrance. Probably from the same as agkale; a mass, i.e. Burden.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From hamartano; a sin.
From eu and a derivative of a presumed compound of peri and histemi; well standing around, i.e. thwarting in every direction.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: Apparently a primary verb; which uses dremo drem'-o as alternate in certain tenses; to run or walk hastily.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Endurance, steadfastness, patient waiting for. From hupomeno; cheerful endurance, constancy.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From ago; properly, a place of assembly, i.e. a contest; figuratively, an effort or anxiety.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: From pro and keimai; to lie before the view, i.e. to be present, to stand forth.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
